channel.title: Laser possibly shooting through CD?
channel.description:
Hey guys,
Recently, I was playing a game and I noticed that everything worked fine except for one thing. The cut scenes and things like that would take a long time to load. I also noticed that it sounded like the laser slider (thing that makes the laser move back and forward) sounded like it was working hard. So I opened the tray cover and saw a red dot (the laser) and I was wondering if that would effect it in anyway, and if so, how could I help prevent make it better (such as putting something over the cd like a sticker). Thanks!

item.title: Laser possibly shooting through CD?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The film (aka data layer as rip4d mentioned) is very thin and will let a laser shine through. Don’t worry the data being read fine. The only thing keeping the laser from shooting through is the label on the CD. I have blank CD’s that I buy that you can almost see through. Its rather fuzzy, but you can make out shapes really well. The data layer is not a mirror, remember that

Read full topic

item.title: Laser possibly shooting through CD?
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

Alright thanks a lot guys.

Read full topic

item.title: Laser possibly shooting through CD?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

That layer of data on top of the plastic disc is very thin, its not surprising a laser could shine through it.

Read full topic

item.title: Laser possibly shooting through CD?
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

It gives that effect like it is. It’s suppose to do that though, because I had problems with my cd drive for my xbox and I played around with it and got the game the play with the shell of the drive off and saw the laser while the game was playing.

Read full topic
